yaml.title: Looking Back At 2024
yaml.author:
Jeremy Selva [`r fontawesome::fa(name = "linkedin", fill = "#0077ac")`](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeremy-selva-085b9112a/){target="_blank"}
@JauntyJJS [`r fontawesome::fa(name = "github", fill = "#000000")`](https://github.com/JauntyJJS){target="_blank"} [`r fontawesome::fa(name = "fab fa-square-x-twitter", fill = "#000000")`](https://twitter.com/JauntyJJS){target="_blank"} [`r fontawesome::fa(name = "bluesky", fill = "#1084ff")`](https://bsky.app/profile/jauntyjjs.bsky.social){target="_blank"} [](https://fosstodon.org/@JauntyJJS){target="_blank"}

markdown.markdown:
```{r} #| label: for scrolly telling #| include: false library(fontawesome) library(knitr) library(yaml) library(rmarkdown) library(fs) library(dplyr) library(quarto) library(sessioninfo) library(reactable) out_type <- knitr::opts_chunk$get("rmarkdown.pandoc.to") ``` As some of the people that I have followed ([Crystal Lewis](https://cghlewis.com/blog/year_2024/){target="_blank"} and [Ken VÅ©](https://kvu777.quarto.pub/the-r-files/posts/every_data_point_everywhere_all_at_once/){target="_blank"}) on social media have written their current life's journey and reflections for 2024 and I also wanted to try out the new [scrollytelling feature in Quarto](https://closeread.netlify.app/){target="_blank"}. I have decided to try something new this year and write my own 2024 reflections using this new Quarto feature. Here goes nothing... - [R4DS Book Club Cohort 9] - [Interprofessional Practice & Education (IPE) Day 2024: Building Bridges, Breaking Barriers](#interprofessional-practice-education-ipe-day-2024-building-bridges-breaking-barriers) - [Sing On 3] - [International Krakow Choir Festival *Cracovia Cantans* 2024] - [useR! 2024] - [European Society of Cardiology (ESC) Congress 2024](#european-society-of-cardiology-esc-congress-2024) - [R User Group Singapore (RUGS) November Meetup](#r-user-group-singapore-rugs-november-meetup) - [Dance Fitness Progress] - [Reflections] ::: cr-section ## R4DS Book Club Cohort 9 Despite an unpredictable working schedule in the hospital, I tried to attend the R for Data Science (R4DS) book club cohort 9, hosted by [Lydia](https://linktr.ee/lgibson7){target="_blank"} and [Ken](https://linktr.ee/kenvu){target="_blank"} since August 2023 at a weekly basis in the [Data Science Learning Community](https://dslc.io/){target="_blank"} (DSLC) slack group.

Join the DSLC slack page at [https://dslc.io/join](https://dslc.io/join){target="_blank"} @cr-DSLC It is hard for me to believe that I could stay on with this cohort till the end when the cohort had the last meeting around February 2023. I ended up making some new friends online as well.

See playlist at [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL3x6DOfs2NGjVMs1NtbWu4s_ZgGhGKnrN](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL3x6DOfs2NGjVMs1NtbWu4s_ZgGhGKnrN){target="_blank"}

Back to top @cr-R4DS ::: {#cr-DSLC .scale-to-fill} ![](images/DSLC.jpg){fig-alt="Preview of the R for Data Science book club in the Data Science Learning Community slack page."} ::: ::: {#cr-R4DS .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## Interprofessional Practice & Education (IPE) Day 2024: Building Bridges, Breaking Barriers {#interprofessional-practice-education-ipe-day-2024-building-bridges-breaking-barriers} I had attended [IPE day](https://www.singhealthdukenus.com.sg/amei/pages/ciphe-events.aspx){target="_blank"} for the first time on 29 Feb 2024. It was an opportunity for healthcare professional to meet up, share and learn how to improve collaboration and the quality of care for patients. @cr-IPE I initially thought that I would be lonely as I was a research officer who had just started his job in less than a year. However, I was wrong. The people that I had met were friendly and just wanted to know me as a person, rather than my limited background in the medical field. [@cr-IPE]{pan-to="500px, 500px" scale-by="2.3"} One of the highlights of the event is NN**IPE**NDO. It is based on a collaborative game inspired by a popular multiplayer game, [Overcooked](https://www.team17.com/games/overcooked){target="_blank"}. The objective was to earn the most gold coins by making dishes within the limitations of each team member's assigned role.

I was assigned as the cook and had to cut and paste ingredients on the paper to create a dish but I could not leave the table to get the ingredients. The role turned out to be great for a quiet observer (and data cleaner) like me as I am able to create the dishes quickly in spite of the many ingredients scattered across the table. The team that I was in managed to get second place.

Back to top @cr-NNI ::: {#cr-IPE .scale-to-fill} ![](images/IPE_2024_1.jpg){fig-alt="Group photo taken during the Interprofessional Practice & Education Day 2024."} ::: ::: {#cr-NNI} ![](images/IPE_2024_2.jpg){fig-alt="My team playing a collaborative game inspired by a popular multiplayer game Overcooked."} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## Sing On 3 Not many people may know this but I am actually in a [university alumni choir](https://linktr.ee/ntuchoir_alumni){target="_blank"}. For someone with limited background and interest in music, it seems like a miracle that I have been in this singing group for close to 10 years. @cr-singonchoir For now, I belong to the Tenor section in the choir. @cr-singontenor On April, the choir managed to have their own concert called Sing On 3: Contemplation.

![](images/Sing_On_3.jpg){fig-alt="Poster of Sing On 3 Choir concert."}

Here is the [link](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGAhglonYU/s_2MjlLOdPU46IWf7_3jcg/view?utm_content=DAGAhglonYU&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link&utm_source=viewer){target="_blank"} to the program booklet. @cr-singonconcert Learning and memorizing new scores was a challenge for me but I still managed to pull through a decent performance and catch up with my university classmates along the way.

Back to top @cr-singonfriends ::: {#cr-singonchoir .scale-to-fill} ![](images/Sing_On_Choir_1.jpg){fig-alt="Choir group photo taken of us laughing for Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ![](images/Sing_On_Choir_2.jpg){fig-alt="Choir group photo taken of us smiling for Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ::: ::: {#cr-singontenor} ![](images/Sing_On_Tenor.jpg){fig-alt="Tenors group photo taken for Sing on 3 choir concert."} ::: ::: {#cr-singonconcert .scale-to-fill} ![](images/Sing_On_Concert.jpg){fig-alt="Formal choir group photo taken during Sing on 3 choir concert."} ::: ::: {#cr-singonfriends .scale-to-fill} ![](images/Sing_On_Me.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of me singing during Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ![](images/Sing_On_Friends.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of me with my university classmates after Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## International Krakow Choir Festival *Cracovia Cantans* 2024 I was then taken for a wild ride when the choir was preparing for a [choir competition](https://www.cracoviacantans.com/previous_editions2024.html){target="_blank"} in Krakow, Poland on June 2024. Practice during the period of May was intense as I was not used to learning and memorising scores for a very short time and was afraid that my body could not keep up with the long hours of singing. @cr-krakowperform Nevertheless, the choir managed to obtain a silver diploma in the mixed choir adults category and a gold diploma in the popular & folk music, gospel, spirituals category.

Back to top @cr-krakowawards ::: {#cr-krakowperform .scale-to-fill} ![](images/krakow_perform.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of the choir singing in the International Krakow Choir Festival Cracovia Cantans 2024."} ::: ::: {#cr-krakowawards .scale-to-fill} ![](images/krakow_awards.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of the choir with the diplomas in the International Krakow Choir Festival Cracovia Cantans 2024." fig-align="center" width="60%"} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## useR! 2024 On July, I was given the chance to attend the [useR! 2024 conference](https://events.linuxfoundation.org/user/){target="_blank"} at Salzburg, Austria. I am grateful to the organizers for accepting my abstract and National Heart Centre Singapore for letting me spend some quality time with the R community. @cr-useR2024 During the conference, I had presented some data extraction and validation tips on how to deal with formatted tabular data from Excel. @cr-useR2024-present Despite my introvert nature, I managed to make new connections like Thomas Vroylandt, Wenjie Sun, Reiko Okamoto, Juan Claramunt, Shannon Pileggi, Kelly Bodwin, Evan Masango, Binod Jung Bogati and many others who are interested in what I do.

By pure serendipity, I also won a book while playing a small game at the [cynkra](https://www.cynkra.com/){target="_blank"} booth and had it signed by [David Granjon](https://david.rinterface.com/){target="_blank"}, the author.

Back to top @cr-useR2024-book ::: {#cr-useR2024 .scale-to-fill} ![](images/useR!_2024.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of me in the useR! 2024 conference in Salzburg, Austria." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-useR2024-present .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: {#cr-useR2024-book .scale-to-fill} ![](images/useR!_book.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of an autographed book titled Outstanding User interfaces with Shiny by David Granjon that I have won during the useR! 2024 conference." fig-align="center" width="80%"} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## European Society of Cardiology (ESC) Congress 2024 {#european-society-of-cardiology-esc-congress-2024} As a research officer from National Heart Centre Singapore, I am heavily involved in the [Global Pretest Probability Study of Coronary Artery Disease (GPS-CAD) study](https://clinicaltrials.gov/study/NCT05722145){target="_blank"}.

My task involves collecting, cleaning and harmonising clinical data from at least fourteen different hospitals and clinical trials. The harmonised data are then sent to other data analysts and statisticians for further analysis. @cr-gpscad-intro August 2024 was a significant milestone for the study as it was presented during a late breaking science session in the [European Society of Cardiology (ESC) Congress](https://esc365.escardio.org/esc-congress){target="_blank"} at London.

Back to top @cr-gpscad-present ::: {#cr-gpscad-intro .scale-to-fill} ![](images/gpscad_intro.jpg){fig-alt="Picture introducing the Global Pretest Probability Study of Coronary Artery Disease Study which aims to explore current risk predictions and pretest probability tools from large cardiac computed computed tomography studies and cohorts worldwide."} ::: ::: {#cr-gpscad-present .scale-to-fill} ![](images/gpscad_present.jpg){fig-alt="Picture showing my manager presenting the Global Pretest Probability Study of Coronary Artery Disease Study in the European Society of Cardiology Congress 2024."} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## R User Group Singapore (RUGS) November Meetup {#r-user-group-singapore-rugs-november-meetup} It started when an R enthusiast, [Nien Xian](https://www.nienxiangtou.com/){target="_blank"} contacted me via Linkedin around March 2024 and expressed interest in meeting other R users in Singapore. This led to a series of events that caused the revivial of the [R User Group Singapore (RUGS) Meetup](https://www.meetup.com/r-user-group-sg/){target="_blank"} on November 2024 after its hiatus for a few years, in spite of limited experience and resources.

@cr-rugs During the event, I had presented how to create a simple [Quarto dashboard](https://quarto.org/docs/dashboards/){target="_blank"} of Singaporeâ€™s Fertility rate using the fertility and live birth datasets that was available at @cr-rugs-present Here is how the [fertility dashboard](https://jauntyjjs.github.io/fertility_dashboard/){target="_blank"} looks like

Back to top @cr-rugs-dashboard ::: {#cr-rugs .scale-to-fill} ![](images/rugs.jpg){fig-alt="Poster advetising the R User Group Singapore meetup during late November." fig-align="center" width="80%"} ::: ::: {#cr-rugs-present .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: {#cr-rugs-dashboard .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## Dance Fitness Progress During childhood, I was not physically active as I was not good in sports and other fitness related activities.

I still remember that I was scolded during a kickboxing class for punching like a girl, move as if I was dancing, falling down most of the time and even punching the instructor by mistake because I was afraid and closed my eyes.

Most people warned be that I would suffer greatly when I entered military life. @cr-boy-cry There was a period after graduating from university that I wanted to find a physical activity that I can cope and enjoy in spite of my bad experiences in the past.

I tried different things from yoga to mixed martial art and then realized that dance fitness was for me (even though it is more popular activity for woman rather than man) not because I was good at dancing but like the R community, the people were friendly and willing to guide me on the dance steps. @cr-dance-fitness I then started doing Kpop X Fitness around 7 years ago and later Zumba in 2020 from instructor [Jaenny](https://www.instagram.com/just.being.jaenny/){target="_blank"} during the COVID period when I feel that I am able to handle a full one-hour class. Here are some videos and photos that was taken this year by [Jaenny](https://www.instagram.com/just.being.jaenny/){target="_blank"} or her husband [James](https://www.instagram.com/jiemisi/){target="_blank"}.

Back to top @cr-dance-photos ::: {#cr-boy-cry .scale-to-fill} ![Cartoon little boy crying by [Vecteezy](https://www.vecteezy.com/vector-art/15219850-cartoon-little-boy-crying-on-white-background){target="_blank"}](images/cartoon-little-boy-crying.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of a little boy crying." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-dance-fitness .scale-to-fill} ![People participating together in a fitness dance class by [Freepik](https://www.freepik.com/free-vector/people-participating-together-fitness-dance-class_12980311.htm){target="_blank"}](images/people-participating-together-fitness-dance-class.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of people participating together in a fitness dance class." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-dance-photos .scale-to-fill} ::: panel-tabset ### National Day Photo ![](images/national_day.jpg){fig-alt="Pictures of me with the dance fitness community taken during Singapore's National Day." fig-align="center" width="50%"} ### Deepavali Photo ![](images/deepavali_dance.jpg){fig-alt="Pictures of me with the dance fitness community taken during Deepavali." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ### Deepavali Video {{< video images/deepavali_video.mp4 width="700" height="500">}} ### Christmas Photo ![](images/christmas_dance.jpg){fig-alt="Pictures of me with the dance fitness community taken during an advanced Chirstmas celebration workout." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ### Christmas Video {{< video images/christmas_video.mp4 width="300" height="500">}} ::: ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## Reflections During reservist in 2021, a kind soul gave me a lift home from my reservist camp. While driving, he asked me what my hobbies were. "Not much." was my reply.

Despite being told by someone during my national service that I write interesting stories about myself, I am someone who personally avoid looking back about my life or writing reflections. This is mainly because I am afraid of being embarrassed or laughed at after sharing about own interests and hobbies. @cr-embarrass Like [Belle](https://disney.fandom.com/wiki/Belle){target="_blank"} from Disneyâ€™s [Beauty and the Beast](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0101414/){target="_blank"}, I am always been seen as different from many people and find it hard to fit in.

For example, many of my colleagues works in [Python](https://www.python.org/){target="_blank"} but I work in [R](https://www.r-project.org/){target="_blank"}. Most of my friends goes to the gym and do combat fitness like kickboxing and martial arts but I prefer to go to a dance fitness classes. People I know like to play many kinds of PC/Xbox/Nintendo games from PokÃ©mon to soccer but I collect [Precious Moments](https://www.preciousmoments.com/){target="_blank"} angel figurines. People I know goes for holidays during the November or December but I stay in Singapore and do caroling instead. People I know uses [Tiktok](https://www.tiktok.com/){target="_blank"} and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/){target="_blank"} to find the latest trends of things but I use [X](https://x.com/?lang=en){target="_blank"} and later [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/){target="_blank"}, [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/){target="_blank"} and [Fosstodon](https://fosstodon.org/){target="_blank"} instead. The list can go onâ€¦

Sometimes, I find it hard to keep a conservation going because usually the conversation ends abruptly after I have shared that I am not working on the same thing or I do not know what kind of questions to ask because I have no clue what the other party is talking about. @cr-eggs Yet, looking back at what I have done in 2024. It appears that I have made a lot of decent achievements and self-fulfilling things in life.

It reminds me of the story about the professor showing a piece of white paper with a black dot to his students and asked them what do they see. Like the students, I was too blinded and preoccupied by my weaknesses and failings (represented by the black dot) that I failed to see the positive things I had done (represented by the white part of the paper) even though they were so many. @cr-black-dot Perhaps, I should focus more on taking my eyes away from the black dots in my life and learn to be more mindful about the blessings and moments in my life that makes be happy and satisfied. @cr-mindful The events in 2024 remind me that there are people out there who are interested in the work that I do, will appreciate my talents and accepting to my short coming. I just need to have more self love, faith and courage to get up of my comfort zone to find, meet and hopefully have a fruitful relationship with them. @cr-self-love No matter how poor and unfair our lives can be, how much pain and suffering we are going through or how lonely and depressed we feel, our lives on earth are still a gift from God. It is all right and normal to feel down, afraid or to be not at your best sometimes. It is just part of being human. We should not be living life in the shadows. As long as we are still alive, it is never too late to make the best use of it.

Back to top @cr-life_is ::: {#cr-embarrass .scale-to-fill} ![Timid man covering face with hand and peeking through, embarrassing, feeling sorry, shying in [Vecteezy](https://www.vecteezy.com/vector-art/7938804-vector-concept-illustration-of-timid-man-covering-face-with-hand-and-peeking-through-embarrassing-feeling-sorry-shying-flat-cartoon-style){target="_blank"}](images/timid-man-covering-face.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of a timid man covering his face with his hand and peeking through." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ::: ::: {#cr-eggs .scale-to-fill} ![Eggs in tray on white surface by [Daniel Reche](https://www.pexels.com/@daniel-reche-718241/){target="_blank"} in [Pexels](https://www.pexels.com/photo/eggs-in-tray-on-white-surface-1556707/){target="_blank"}](images/eggs_in_tray_on_white_surface.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of a few white eggs in an egg carton being hostile to a brown egg because it looks different." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-black-dot .scale-to-fill} ![Output from [Gemini 1.5 Flash](https://gemini.google.com/){target="_blank"} using prompt "Black pen making a dot on a white paper"](images/black_dot.jpg){fig-alt="Black pen making a dot on a white paper" fig-align="center"width="70%"} ::: ::: {#cr-mindful .scale-to-fill} ![](images/mindful_1.jpg){fig-alt="Picture showing the values of mindfulness" fig-align="center" width="60%"} ![](images/mindful_2.jpg){fig-alt="Picture showing the values of mindfulness in details" fig-align="center" width="60%"} ::: ::: {#cr-self-love .scale-to-fill} ![](images/self_love.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of cards showing the need to have self love, take it easy and to have positive vibes." fig-align="center" width="80%"} ::: ::: {#cr-life_is .scale-to-fill} ![Life is a gift from God poster from [Char Kantha Martin Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/groups/620889571585087/posts/2293341987673162/){target="_blank"}](images/life_is.jpg){fig-alt="Infograph showing that each person is given the gift of life to live, learn and to live a legacy." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: ## R Session and Packages Used Here are the R packages used. ```{r} #| label: R Package Used #| title: "ðŸ“¦ R Packages Used" get_r_package_info <- function() { r_package_table <- sessioninfo::package_info() rownames(r_package_table) <- NULL r_package_table <- r_package_table |> tibble::as_tibble() |> dplyr::mutate( version = ifelse(is.na(r_package_table$loadedversion), r_package_table$ondiskversion, r_package_table$loadedversion)) |> dplyr::filter(.data[["attached"]] == TRUE) |> dplyr::select( dplyr::any_of(c("package", "version", "date", "source")) ) return(r_package_table) } get_r_package_info() |> reactable::reactable( defaultPageSize = 5, paginationType = "jump", ) ``` Here is the R session used to generate this webpage. ```{r} #| label: R Session Info #| title: "ðŸ’» R Session Info" get_quarto_version <- function( test_sys_path = FALSE, test_no_path = FALSE ) { # Taken from https://github.com/r-lib/sessioninfo/issues/75 if (isNamespaceLoaded("quarto") && isFALSE(test_sys_path)) { path <- quarto::quarto_path() |> fs::path_real() ver <- system("quarto -V", intern = TRUE) if (is.null(path) || isTRUE(test_no_path)) { "NA (via quarto)" } else { paste0(ver, " @ ", path, "/ (via quarto)") } } else { path <- Sys.which("quarto") |> fs::path_real() if (path == "" || isTRUE(test_no_path)) { "NA" } else { ver <- system("quarto -V", intern = TRUE) paste0(ver, " @ ", path) } } } get_knitr_version <- function() { knitr_info <- "NA" r_package_table <- sessioninfo::package_info( pkgs = c("installed") ) |> dplyr::filter(.data[["package"]] == "knitr") if (nrow(r_package_table) == 1) { knitr_version <- r_package_table$loadedversion[1] knitr_source <- r_package_table$source[1] knitr_info <- paste0( knitr_version, " from ", knitr_source) } return(knitr_info) } get_r_platform_info <- function() { r_platform_table <- sessioninfo::platform_info() r_platform_table[["quarto"]] <- get_quarto_version()[1] r_platform_table[["knitr"]] <- get_knitr_version()[1] r_platform_table <- data.frame( setting = names(r_platform_table), value = unlist(r_platform_table, use.names = FALSE), stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) return(r_platform_table) } r_platform_table <- get_r_platform_info() r_platform_table |> reactable::reactable( defaultPageSize = 5, paginationType = "jump", ) ```

I have decided to try something new this year and write my own 2024 reflections using this new Quarto feature. For someone with limited background and interest in music, it seems like a miracle that I have been in this singing group for close to 10 years. @cr-singonchoir For now, I belong to the Tenor section in the choir. @cr-singontenor On April, the choir managed to have their own concert called Sing On 3: Contemplation.

![](images/Sing_On_3.jpg){fig-alt="Poster of Sing On 3 Choir concert."}

Here is the [link](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGAhglonYU/s_2MjlLOdPU46IWf7_3jcg/view?utm_content=DAGAhglonYU&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link&utm_source=viewer){target="_blank"} to the program booklet. @cr-singonconcert Learning and memorizing new scores was a challenge for me but I still managed to pull through a decent performance and catch up with my university classmates along the way.

Back to top @cr-singonfriends ::: {#cr-singonchoir .scale-to-fill} ![](images/Sing_On_Choir_1.jpg){fig-alt="Choir group photo taken of us laughing for Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ![](images/Sing_On_Choir_2.jpg){fig-alt="Choir group photo taken of us smiling for Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ::: ::: {#cr-singontenor} ![](images/Sing_On_Tenor.jpg){fig-alt="Tenors group photo taken for Sing on 3 choir concert."} ::: ::: {#cr-singonconcert .scale-to-fill} ![](images/Sing_On_Concert.jpg){fig-alt="Formal choir group photo taken during Sing on 3 choir concert."} ::: ::: {#cr-singonfriends .scale-to-fill} ![](images/Sing_On_Me.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of me singing during Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ![](images/Sing_On_Friends.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of me with my university classmates after Sing on 3 choir concert." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## International Krakow Choir Festival *Cracovia Cantans* 2024 I was then taken for a wild ride when the choir was preparing for a [choir competition](https://www.cracoviacantans.com/previous_editions2024.html){target="_blank"} in Krakow, Poland on June 2024. Practice during the period of May was intense as I was not used to learning and memorising scores for a very short time and was afraid that my body could not keep up with the long hours of singing. @cr-krakowperform Nevertheless, the choir managed to obtain a silver diploma in the mixed choir adults category and a gold diploma in the popular & folk music, gospel, spirituals category.

Back to top @cr-krakowawards ::: {#cr-krakowperform .scale-to-fill} ![](images/krakow_perform.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of the choir singing in the International Krakow Choir Festival Cracovia Cantans 2024."} ::: ::: {#cr-krakowawards .scale-to-fill} ![](images/krakow_awards.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of the choir with the diplomas in the International Krakow Choir Festival Cracovia Cantans 2024." fig-align="center" width="60%"} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## useR! 2024 On July, I was given the chance to attend the [useR! 2024 conference](https://events.linuxfoundation.org/user/){target="_blank"} at Salzburg, Austria. I am grateful to the organizers for accepting my abstract and National Heart Centre Singapore for letting me spend some quality time with the R community. @cr-useR2024 During the conference, I had presented some data extraction and validation tips on how to deal with formatted tabular data from Excel. @cr-useR2024-present Despite my introvert nature, I managed to make new connections like Thomas Vroylandt, Wenjie Sun, Reiko Okamoto, Juan Claramunt, Shannon Pileggi, Kelly Bodwin, Evan Masango, Binod Jung Bogati and many others who are interested in what I do.

By pure serendipity, I also won a book while playing a small game at the [cynkra](https://www.cynkra.com/){target="_blank"} booth and had it signed by [David Granjon](https://david.rinterface.com/){target="_blank"}, the author.

Back to top @cr-useR2024-book ::: {#cr-useR2024 .scale-to-fill} ![](images/useR!_2024.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of me in the useR! 2024 conference in Salzburg, Austria." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-useR2024-present .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: {#cr-useR2024-book .scale-to-fill} ![](images/useR!_book.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of an autographed book titled Outstanding User interfaces with Shiny by David Granjon that I have won during the useR! 2024 conference." fig-align="center" width="80%"} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## European Society of Cardiology (ESC) Congress 2024 {#european-society-of-cardiology-esc-congress-2024} As a research officer from National Heart Centre Singapore, I am heavily involved in the [Global Pretest Probability Study of Coronary Artery Disease (GPS-CAD) study](https://clinicaltrials.gov/study/NCT05722145){target="_blank"}.

My task involves collecting, cleaning and harmonising clinical data from at least fourteen different hospitals and clinical trials. The harmonised data are then sent to other data analysts and statisticians for further analysis. @cr-gpscad-intro August 2024 was a significant milestone for the study as it was presented during a late breaking science session in the [European Society of Cardiology (ESC) Congress](https://esc365.escardio.org/esc-congress){target="_blank"} at London.

Back to top @cr-gpscad-present ::: {#cr-gpscad-intro .scale-to-fill} ![](images/gpscad_intro.jpg){fig-alt="Picture introducing the Global Pretest Probability Study of Coronary Artery Disease Study which aims to explore current risk predictions and pretest probability tools from large cardiac computed computed tomography studies and cohorts worldwide."} ::: ::: {#cr-gpscad-present .scale-to-fill} ![](images/gpscad_present.jpg){fig-alt="Picture showing my manager presenting the Global Pretest Probability Study of Coronary Artery Disease Study in the European Society of Cardiology Congress 2024."} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## R User Group Singapore (RUGS) November Meetup {#r-user-group-singapore-rugs-november-meetup} It started when an R enthusiast, [Nien Xian](https://www.nienxiangtou.com/){target="_blank"} contacted me via Linkedin around March 2024 and expressed interest in meeting other R users in Singapore. This led to a series of events that caused the revivial of the [R User Group Singapore (RUGS) Meetup](https://www.meetup.com/r-user-group-sg/){target="_blank"} on November 2024 after its hiatus for a few years, in spite of limited experience and resources.

@cr-rugs During the event, I had presented how to create a simple [Quarto dashboard](https://quarto.org/docs/dashboards/){target="_blank"} of Singaporeâ€™s Fertility rate using the fertility and live birth datasets that was available at @cr-rugs-present Here is how the [fertility dashboard](https://jauntyjjs.github.io/fertility_dashboard/){target="_blank"} looks like

Back to top @cr-rugs-dashboard ::: {#cr-rugs .scale-to-fill} ![](images/rugs.jpg){fig-alt="Poster advetising the R User Group Singapore meetup during late November." fig-align="center" width="80%"} ::: ::: {#cr-rugs-present .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: {#cr-rugs-dashboard .scale-to-fill} ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## Dance Fitness Progress During childhood, I was not physically active as I was not good in sports and other fitness related activities.

I still remember that I was scolded during a kickboxing class for punching like a girl, move as if I was dancing, falling down most of the time and even punching the instructor by mistake because I was afraid and closed my eyes.

Most people warned be that I would suffer greatly when I entered military life. @cr-boy-cry There was a period after graduating from university that I wanted to find a physical activity that I can cope and enjoy in spite of my bad experiences in the past.

I tried different things from yoga to mixed martial art and then realized that dance fitness was for me (even though it is more popular activity for woman rather than man) not because I was good at dancing but like the R community, the people were friendly and willing to guide me on the dance steps. @cr-dance-fitness I then started doing Kpop X Fitness around 7 years ago and later Zumba in 2020 from instructor [Jaenny](https://www.instagram.com/just.being.jaenny/){target="_blank"} during the COVID period when I feel that I am able to handle a full one-hour class. Here are some videos and photos that was taken this year by [Jaenny](https://www.instagram.com/just.being.jaenny/){target="_blank"} or her husband [James](https://www.instagram.com/jiemisi/){target="_blank"}.

Back to top @cr-dance-photos ::: {#cr-boy-cry .scale-to-fill} ![Cartoon little boy crying by [Vecteezy](https://www.vecteezy.com/vector-art/15219850-cartoon-little-boy-crying-on-white-background){target="_blank"}](images/cartoon-little-boy-crying.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of a little boy crying." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-dance-fitness .scale-to-fill} ![People participating together in a fitness dance class by [Freepik](https://www.freepik.com/free-vector/people-participating-together-fitness-dance-class_12980311.htm){target="_blank"}](images/people-participating-together-fitness-dance-class.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of people participating together in a fitness dance class." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-dance-photos .scale-to-fill} ::: panel-tabset ### National Day Photo ![](images/national_day.jpg){fig-alt="Pictures of me with the dance fitness community taken during Singapore's National Day." fig-align="center" width="50%"} ### Deepavali Photo ![](images/deepavali_dance.jpg){fig-alt="Pictures of me with the dance fitness community taken during Deepavali." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ### Deepavali Video {{< video images/deepavali_video.mp4 width="700" height="500">}} ### Christmas Photo ![](images/christmas_dance.jpg){fig-alt="Pictures of me with the dance fitness community taken during an advanced Chirstmas celebration workout." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ### Christmas Video {{< video images/christmas_video.mp4 width="300" height="500">}} ::: ::: ::: ::: cr-section ## Reflections During reservist in 2021, a kind soul gave me a lift home from my reservist camp. While driving, he asked me what my hobbies were. "Not much." was my reply.

Despite being told by someone during my national service that I write interesting stories about myself, I am someone who personally avoid looking back about my life or writing reflections. This is mainly because I am afraid of being embarrassed or laughed at after sharing about own interests and hobbies. @cr-embarrass Like [Belle](https://disney.fandom.com/wiki/Belle){target="_blank"} from Disneyâ€™s [Beauty and the Beast](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0101414/){target="_blank"}, I am always been seen as different from many people and find it hard to fit in.

For example, many of my colleagues works in [Python](https://www.python.org/){target="_blank"} but I work in [R](https://www.r-project.org/){target="_blank"}. Most of my friends goes to the gym and do combat fitness like kickboxing and martial arts but I prefer to go to a dance fitness classes. People I know like to play many kinds of PC/Xbox/Nintendo games from PokÃ©mon to soccer but I collect [Precious Moments](https://www.preciousmoments.com/){target="_blank"} angel figurines. People I know goes for holidays during the November or December but I stay in Singapore and do caroling instead. People I know uses [Tiktok](https://www.tiktok.com/){target="_blank"} and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/){target="_blank"} to find the latest trends of things but I use [X](https://x.com/?lang=en){target="_blank"} and later [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/){target="_blank"}, [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/){target="_blank"} and [Fosstodon](https://fosstodon.org/){target="_blank"} instead. The list can go onâ€¦

Sometimes, I find it hard to keep a conservation going because usually the conversation ends abruptly after I have shared that I am not working on the same thing or I do not know what kind of questions to ask because I have no clue what the other party is talking about. @cr-eggs Yet, looking back at what I have done in 2024. It appears that I have made a lot of decent achievements and self-fulfilling things in life.

It reminds me of the story about the professor showing a piece of white paper with a black dot to his students and asked them what do they see. Like the students, I was too blinded and preoccupied by my weaknesses and failings (represented by the black dot) that I failed to see the positive things I had done (represented by the white part of the paper) even though they were so many. @cr-black-dot Perhaps, I should focus more on taking my eyes away from the black dots in my life and learn to be more mindful about the blessings and moments in my life that makes be happy and satisfied. @cr-mindful The events in 2024 remind me that there are people out there who are interested in the work that I do, will appreciate my talents and accepting to my short coming. I just need to have more self love, faith and courage to get up of my comfort zone to find, meet and hopefully have a fruitful relationship with them. @cr-self-love No matter how poor and unfair our lives can be, how much pain and suffering we are going through or how lonely and depressed we feel, our lives on earth are still a gift from God. It is all right and normal to feel down, afraid or to be not at your best sometimes. It is just part of being human. We should not be living life in the shadows. As long as we are still alive, it is never too late to make the best use of it.

Back to top @cr-life_is ::: {#cr-embarrass .scale-to-fill} ![Timid man covering face with hand and peeking through, embarrassing, feeling sorry, shying in [Vecteezy](https://www.vecteezy.com/vector-art/7938804-vector-concept-illustration-of-timid-man-covering-face-with-hand-and-peeking-through-embarrassing-feeling-sorry-shying-flat-cartoon-style){target="_blank"}](images/timid-man-covering-face.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of a timid man covering his face with his hand and peeking through." fig-align="center" width="70%"} ::: ::: {#cr-eggs .scale-to-fill} ![Eggs in tray on white surface by [Daniel Reche](https://www.pexels.com/@daniel-reche-718241/){target="_blank"} in [Pexels](https://www.pexels.com/photo/eggs-in-tray-on-white-surface-1556707/){target="_blank"}](images/eggs_in_tray_on_white_surface.jpg){fig-alt="Cartoon of a few white eggs in an egg carton being hostile to a brown egg because it looks different." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: {#cr-black-dot .scale-to-fill} ![Output from [Gemini 1.5 Flash](https://gemini.google.com/){target="_blank"} using prompt "Black pen making a dot on a white paper"](images/black_dot.jpg){fig-alt="Black pen making a dot on a white paper" fig-align="center"width="70%"} ::: ::: {#cr-mindful .scale-to-fill} ![](images/mindful_1.jpg){fig-alt="Picture showing the values of mindfulness" fig-align="center" width="60%"} ![](images/mindful_2.jpg){fig-alt="Picture showing the values of mindfulness in details" fig-align="center" width="60%"} ::: ::: {#cr-self-love .scale-to-fill} ![](images/self_love.jpg){fig-alt="Picture of cards showing the need to have self love, take it easy and to have positive vibes." fig-align="center" width="80%"} ::: ::: {#cr-life_is .scale-to-fill} ![Life is a gift from God poster from [Char Kantha Martin Facebook post](https://www.facebook.com/groups/620889571585087/posts/2293341987673162/){target="_blank"}](images/life_is.jpg){fig-alt="Infograph showing that each person is given the gift of life to live, learn and to live a legacy." fig-align="center"} ::: ::: ## R Session and Packages Used Here are the R packages used. ```{r} #| label: R Package Used #| title: "ðŸ“¦ R Packages Used" get_r_package_info <- function() { r_package_table <- sessioninfo::package_info() rownames(r_package_table) <- NULL r_package_table <- r_package_table |> tibble::as_tibble() |> dplyr::mutate( version = ifelse(is.na(r_package_table$loadedversion), r_package_table$ondiskversion, r_package_table$loadedversion)) |> dplyr::filter(.data[["attached"]] == TRUE) |> dplyr::select( dplyr::any_of(c("package", "version", "date", "source")) ) return(r_package_table) } get_r_package_info() |> reactable::reactable( defaultPageSize = 5, paginationType = "jump", ) ``` Here is the R session used to generate this webpage. ```{r} #| label: R Session Info #| title: "ðŸ’» R Session Info" get_quarto_version <- function( test_sys_path = FALSE, test_no_path = FALSE ) { # Taken from https://github.com/r-lib/sessioninfo/issues/75 if (isNamespaceLoaded("quarto") && isFALSE(test_sys_path)) { path <- quarto::quarto_path() |> fs::path_real() ver <- system("quarto -V", intern = TRUE) if (is.null(path) || isTRUE(test_no_path)) { "NA (via quarto)" } else { paste0(ver, " @ ", path, "/ (via quarto)") } } else { path <- Sys.which("quarto") |> fs::path_real() if (path == "" || isTRUE(test_no_path)) { "NA" } else { ver <- system("quarto -V", intern = TRUE) paste0(ver, " @ ", path) } } } get_knitr_version <- function() { knitr_info <- "NA" r_package_table <- sessioninfo::package_info( pkgs = c("installed") ) |> dplyr::filter(.data[["package"]] == "knitr") if (nrow(r_package_table) == 1) { knitr_version <- r_package_table$loadedversion[1] knitr_source <- r_package_table$source[1] knitr_info <- paste0( knitr_version, " from ", knitr_source) } return(knitr_info) } get_r_platform_info <- function() { r_platform_table <- sessioninfo::platform_info() r_platform_table[["quarto"]] <- get_quarto_version()[1] r_platform_table[["knitr"]] <- get_knitr_version()[1] r_platform_table <- data.frame( setting = names(r_platform_table), value = unlist(r_platform_table, use.names = FALSE), stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) return(r_platform_table) } r_platform_table <- get_r_platform_info() r_platform_table |> reactable::reactable( defaultPageSize = 5, paginationType = "jump", ) ```
